appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives Rep. Hoyer D-MD on Retirement from Congress : CSPAN : January 11, 2026 3:44pm-3:54pm EST
appearances.snippet: speaker, my dear and close friend steve womack. madam speaker, thank you for being here. my colleagues, my dear friends, mr. scalise, majority leader and, mr. emmer, the majority whip, thank you for being here. mr. speaker, i rise today. obviously mixed emotions and reluctant conviction. there's a true story, i've told many times over the past 60 years. it's about a young man myself who a student at the university of maryland college just a few miles from this place. as a freshman, like many young people, i lacked a vision for. my future. i nearly flunked out of college and didn't even roll. in the 1958 fall semester here. fortunately for me, i re-enrolled the following spring. there was a spring convocation. april 27th, 1959. classes canceled from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., so that we could all go hear the guest speaker. frankly, i'd planned not to attend. however, i was walking up the hill near fieldhouse where the event was located and i saw again our guest drive in a 1958 pontiac convertible that mr. speaker, was a cool car. so cool that i to go to this convocation that what

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 13, 2026 1:30pm-3:39pm EST
appearances.snippet: that's why representative steve womack and i introduced the tipped employee protection act.his bill replaces the outdated definition of tipped employees with a simpler and more realistic definition. the bill defines a tipped worker as anyone who receives tips and other cash wages that together add up to the federal minimum wage, without worrying about how much time they spend on this or that. this change giv businesses more flexibility and protects them from unfair, crippling penalties for small record keeping mistakes that they might make. this bill resolves a long standing issue that has been the subject of expensive litigation, ensures that the federal government does not set a standard that it cannot reasonably expect to enforce. also, it helps the department of labor focus on real wage violations instead of technical paperwork issues. let's help small businesses. let's help employers. let's do the right thing. let's not work for the people that just want to have endless lawsuits, endless litigation, red tape. i urge everyone to vote yes on h.r. 2312, because businesses

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 2:30pm-6:31pm EST
appearances.snippet: speaker, my dear and close friend steve womack, madam speaker, thank you for being here. my colleagues, my dear friends, mr. scully's, and the majority whip my thank you for being here. arise with mixed emotions and reluctant conviction. there is a true story of told many times over the past 60 years about a young man, myself, a student at the university of maryland college park a few miles from this place. as a freshman, like many young people, i lacked a vision for my future. i nearly funked out of college and didn't even enroll in the 1958 folsom muster. -- fall semester. fortunately for me i reenrolled in the spring. classes were canceled from 11:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. so we could hear guest speaker, i planned not to attend good i was working -- i was walking up the road and i saw our guests drive up in a 1958 pontiac convertible. that was a cool car. so cool that i decided to go to the convocation. that walk was my road to damascus. it changed my life. the speaker was john f. kennedy. in his remarks, he urged us to do our duty in that day of world chaos. he encouraged
